original: Arvidsson, Albert Andreas, läroverksadjunkt, Motala, f. 18/4/88 i Törnevalla, östergötl. 1. G. 15 m. Wanda Anderson. Barn: Eva f. 24, laboratris i Sthlm. — Stud:ex. i Linköp. 08, fil. mag. i Upps. 14, provår 17-18. E. o. adj. i Linköp. 14-15, ämneslär. i Söderköp. 15-17, part. vik. adj. v. norra real i Sthlm 17-18, vik. rektor v. sam-realsk. i Motala 18-20, lär. där 20-21, ord. ämneslär. v. Motala komm. mel-lansk. 21, adj. i matem., fysik o. kemi v. h. a. 1. i Motala sed. 29. Led. av stadsfullm. sed. 31, tryckfrihetsomb. s. å., led. av tax:nd, folkskistyr. o. lärov. lokalstyr., förest, f. Motala stads fö-reläsnianst. 43. Skr.: Räknetab. f. re-alsk. o. komm. mellansk. Hobby: oljemålning.
translated: Arvidsson, Albert Andreas, high school teacher, Motala, born April 18, 1888 in Törnevalla, Östergötland. Married once, to Wanda Anderson, with one child, Eva, born in 1924 and a laboratory technician in Stockholm. Arvidsson received his Studentexamen in Linköping in 1908, a Bachelor of Arts from Uppsala University in 1914, and a one-year teaching training in 1917-1918. He was acting assistant teacher in Linköping in 1914-1915, subject teacher in Söderköping in 1915-1917, substitute assistant teacher at Norra Real in Stockholm in 1917-1918, acting rector of a combined junior and senior high school in Motala in 1918-1920, a teacher there from 1920-1921, and a regular subject teacher at Motala municipal middle school from 1921. Arvidsson was a teacher of mathematics, physics, and chemistry at the high school level in Motala from 1929. He was a member of the city council from 1931, a representative for freedom of the press in the same year, and a member of the tax committee, the public school administration, and the local high school administration. He was also the director of Motala's lecture program in 1943. Arvidsson was the author of a mathematics textbook for high school and middle school students. His hobby was oil painting.

structured.name: Albert Andreas Arvidsson
structured.description: Albert Andreas Arvidsson was a high school teacher from Törnevalla, Östergötland, Sweden. He married once, to Wanda Anderson, and had one child named Eva, born in 1924 and a laboratory technician in Stockholm. Arvidsson was educated at Linköping and Uppsala University, earning his studentexamen in 1908 and his Bachelor of Arts in 1914. He received a one-year teaching training in 1917-1918. Arvidsson worked as an acting assistant teacher in Linköping in 1914-1915, subject teacher in Söderköping in 1915-1917, substitute assistant teacher at Norra Real in Stockholm in 1917-1918, acting rector of a combined junior and senior high school in Motala in 1918-1920. He was a teacher there from 1920-1921 and a regular subject teacher at Motala municipal middle school from 1921. Arvidsson was a teacher of mathematics, physics, and chemistry at the high school level in Motala from 1929. He wrote a mathematics textbook for high school and middle school students and was the director of Motala's lecture program in 1943. He had a hobby of oil painting.
